incorrect.0: That is not the right solution.

empty.2: You forgot to write something here.
empty.3: You have to enter something here.

missingNumber.0: You didn't fill in a number.
missingNumber.1: There should be a number here.
missingNumber.2: Don't forget to enter a number!
missingNumber.4: Oops, there's a number missing here.

missingUnit.0: You didn't fill in a unit.
missingUnit.1: There should be a unit here.
missingUnit.2: Don't forget to enter a unit!
missingUnit.4: Oops, there's a unit missing here.

invalidUnit.0: This is not a valid unit.
invalidUnit.2: This unit does not look correct.
invalidUnit.3: There's something wrong with your unit.
invalidUnit.4: There are faulty parts in your unit.

incorrectUnit.0: Your unit isn't correct. Have a look at that first.
incorrectUnit.1: There's an error in your unit. Fix that first.
incorrectUnit.2: Wrong unit. What unit should the answer have?
incorrectUnit.3: It goes awry at the unit. What should it be?
incorrectUnit.4: Oops, your unit is off. Check that one out.

negative.2: The minus sign shouldn't be there.
negative.3: This number is supposed to be positive.
negative.4: What's that minus sign doing there?

duplicate.0: This value is equal to an earlier solution.
duplicate.1: No, you already gave this solution.
duplicate.2: You already entered this solution above.
duplicate.3: This is not a unique solution.
duplicate.4: Oops, you already filled this one in.

nonNumeric.0: This value is not a number.
nonNumeric.1: There's still a variable in there.
nonNumeric.2: You entered something that is not a number.
nonNumeric.3: This isn't something that can be turned into a number.
nonNumeric.4: Oops, I can't turn this into a number.

numeric.withinMargin: You're still within the margin, but this could be more accurate.
numeric.wrongSign: You haven't used the right sign. Check your pluses and minuses.
numeric.nearby: You're very close! Check for accuracy and rounding errors.
numeric.notZeroPositive: Zero is sadly wrong. We do expect a number here.
numeric.notZeroNegative: Zero is sadly wrong. We do expect a (possibly negative) number here.
numeric.negativeTooLarge: Your answer is (magnitude-based) too small. We expected something even more negative.
numeric.negativeTooSmall: Your answer is (magnitude-based) too large. We expected something closer to zero.
numeric.tooManySignificantDigits: You used too many significant digits.
numeric.tooFewSignificantDigits: You used too few significant digits.
numeric.tooLargePower: The exponent you used is too large.
numeric.tooSmallPower: The exponent you used is too small.

expression.original: This is the original expression. You have not rewritten it yet.
expression.incorrect: This expression is not equal to what has been given. In rewriting it you took a wrong step somewhere.
expression.nonEquivalentSolution: This is not the right solution, nor is it equivalent to it. Check your steps leading up to this.
expression.correct: The expression is correct, but you have not done what was required.
expression.noSum: You have to write your solution as an addition/subtraction of terms. Your solution sadly is not an addition/subtraction.
expression.wrongNumberOfSumTerms: There was supposed to be an addition/subtraction with {expectedNumTerms} terms, each with a plus or minus sign in-between. Your response has {inputNumTerms} terms.
expression.errorInSumTerm: There seems to be an error in the <counting-word/> term of your solution.
expression.unsimplifiedSumTerm: You can still further simplify the <counting-word/> term of your solution.
expression.noProduct: You have to write your solution as a multiplication of factors. Your solution sadly is not a product.
expression.wrongNumberOfProductFactors: There was supposed to be a product with {expectedNumTerms} factors. Your response has {inputNumTerms} factors.
expression.errorInProductFactors: There seems to be an error in the <counting-word/> factor of your solution.
expression.hasX: Your solution still contains <inline-math/>. It's not supposed to be there anymore.
expression.hasNumberSimplifications: You can still simplify the numbers in your solution.
expression.hasProductWithinPowerBase: Your solution has unexpanded brackets at a power.
expression.hasNegativeExponent: The power <inline-math/> in your input has a negative exponent.
expression.hasSumWithinFraction: Your solution has an unseparated fraction.
expression.hasSimilarTerms: This can be simplified further: there is a sum with similar terms that can be merged together.
expression.hasFraction: Your solution still has a fraction. The idea was to remove all fractions.
expression.noFraction: Your solution is not a fraction. A single fraction was expected as answer.
expression.hasFractionWithinFraction: Your solution may not contain fractions within fractions. You can still simplify this further.
expression.hasXInDenominator: You cannot have <inline-math/> appear in any denominator anymore.
expression.unsimplifiedFractionNumbers: The fraction can still be simplified further. Try dividing the numerator and the denominator by the right number.
expression.unsimplifiedFractionFactors: There are still factors that can be canceled in the numerator and the denominator.
expression.fractionNumeratorHasSumWithinProduct: There are still unexpanded brackets in the numerator.
expression.wrongSign: You haven't used the right sign. Check your pluses and minuses.

incorrectFraction.noFraction: Hmm ... a fraction was expected as a solution here.
incorrectFraction.inverted: You entered your fraction the wrong way around. Check carefuly through what factor you're dividing!
incorrectFraction.incorrectNumerator: The numerator of your fraction (above) is not what was expected. Did you apply all the rules correctly?
incorrectFraction.incorrectDenominator: The denominator of your fraction (below) is not what was expected. Did you apply all the rules correctly?
incorrectFraction.constantMultiple: You seem to be off by a constant multiple.

expression.hasPower: Your solution still has an exponent. You can simplify this further.
expression.unsimplifiedPowerMerging: There are still factors in a product that can be pulled together into a power.

equation.original: This is the original equation. You have not rewritten it yet.
equation.incorrect: This equation is not equal to what has been given. In rewriting it you took a wrong step somewhere.
equation.incorrectLeftSide: The left side of the equation is not what was expected.
equation.incorrectRightSide: The right side of the equation is not what was expected.
equation.correct: The equation is correct, but you have not done what was required.

fullFeedback.oneSideCorrect: The <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side of the equation is correct, but something's wrong on the <check><on-true>right</on-true><on-false>left</on-false></check> side. <check><on-true>You have not done what was required.</on-true><on-false>You took a wrong step somewhere.</on-false></check>
fullFeedback.sidesSwitched: Oops ... you have switched the left and the right side of the equation. Try switching them back!
fullFeedback.oneSideSwitched: The <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side of your equation is correct, but it should be on the <check><on-true>right</on-true><on-false>left</on-false></check>. The <check><on-true>right</on-true><on-false>left</on-false></check> side of your equation still has some errors you might want to look at.

equation.noSum: You have only written a single term on the <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side. A sum was expected here: an addition/subtraction of terms.
equation.hasSum: You have written a sum on the <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side: an addition/subtraction of terms. Only a single term was expected here.
equation.wrongNumberOfSumTerms: The sum on the <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side of the equals sign has <counting-word/> terms. There were <counting-word/> terms expected.
equation.errorInSumTerm: There seems to be an error in the <counting-word/> term on the <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side.
equation.errorInSide: There seems to be an error in the <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side of the equation.
equation.unsimplifiedSumTerm: You can still simplify the <counting-word/> term on the <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side.
equation.unsimplifiedSide: You can still simplify the <check><on-true>left</on-true><on-false>right</on-false></check> side.
